Description - No work shall commence until a valid Permit to Tunnel has been signed off for the current section of excavation

Description - The Constructor shall propose a method for a preconstruction trial of the groundwater control system and submit it to the Designer’s Representative for review.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0653 - Tunnel Groundwater Control Systems Clause 6
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Verifying Records - Groundwater control system methodology

Description - Where the inflow into the tunnel exceeds 3L/m of length/day averaged over a 100m length of tunnel, appropriate post-installed drainage measures shall be proposed by the Constructor and approved by the Designer’s representative.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0653 - Tunnel Groundwater Control Systems Clause 6
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the remedial work
Verifying Records - Post-installation groundwater control system methodology

Description - A preconstruction trial shall be carried out by the Constructor to demonstrate the effectiveness of the connections of strip drains from the top heading to the bench, unless using approved manufacturer's recommended connections installed to the manufacturer's specification.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0653 - Tunnel Groundwater Control Systems Clause 6
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Verifying Records - Groundwater control system Trial Results

Description - A pre-construction trial shall be carried out by the constructure to demonstrate that the proposed grout used is able to fully encapsulate the bolt using the proposed installation method
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0652 - Tunnel Rock Reinforcement Clause 6.2

Conformance Criteria - Compliance with Technical Specification - C0652 - Tunnel Rock Reinforcement Clause 6.2.
Verifying Records - The rock reinforcement Trial Results

Description - The Constructor shall conduct a Investigation test (pre-production) on sacrificial rock reinforcements and tested progressively to failure. Investigation load test rock reinforcements are to be installed at locations, agreed with the Designer’s Representative.
○ The Constructor shall notify the Designer’s Representative with a minimum of 48 hour notice.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0652 - Tunnel Rock Reinforcement Clause 6.1

Test frequency - Prior to the commencement with A minimum of six investigation tests shall be carried out for each type of rock, grout mix, and rock bolt or dowel orientation, or as agreed upon with the Designer’s Representative.
Conformance Criteria - Compliance with Technical Specification - C0652 - Tunnel Rock Reinforcement Clause 6.1.

Description - The Constructor shall conduct end anchorage test with a minimum of six rock bolts per proposed rock reinforcement system shall be tested in each ground type. For acceptance of end anchorage, all individual bolts shall achieve the pre-tension load shown on the Drawings.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0652 - Tunnel Rock Reinforcement Clause 6.3
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement with A minimum of six tests shall be carried out in each ground type.
Conformance Criteria - Compliance with Technical Specification - C0652 - Tunnel Rock Reinforcement Clause 6.3.

Description - Details of all equipment to be approved by the designers representative

Description - A trial shall be carried out in advance of tunnelling activities to identify optimum drill bit, drill diameter and flushing and percussion rates

ITP - Excavation and Support - 3.0 Shotcrete Testing
template name: ITP - Excavation and Support - 3.0 Shotcrete Testing Rev 1

name: Description - Test prior to each personnel entry and/or face advance.
○ Test results must be verified once a month during construction.
○ Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Table 6.4
Test frequency - Initially test prior to each personnel entry after spraying primary shotcrete. Once established, this curve must be verified once a month during construction.

Conformance Criteria - ST1/1A/1B/2/3/3A - minimum of 50mm thick shotcrete layer that has achieved minimum compressive strength of 1mpa combined with remotely installed pattern rockbolts and spot bolts as required or as directed by the designer's representative. rockbolt grout to have achieved a compressive strength of at least 3mpa.
○ ST3B - minimum 100mm thick shotcrete layer that has achieved minimum compressive strength of 1mpa
Verifying Records - Beam End Test Results
3.2 - Beam End Test (early age compressive strength)
Description - Safe shotcrete strength before next advancement to max. advance length
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Table 6.1 and 6.4
Test frequency - Initially test prior to each personnel entry after spraying primary shotcrete. Once established, this curve must be verified once a month during construction.
Conformance Criteria - From the Specification the following applies:
Verifying Records - Beam End Test Results
Description - To prove compressive strength compliance requirement
○ Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Table 6.1 and 6.4
Test frequency - 1 test (I test shall include 4 cored specimen, 3 tested and 1 spare) for the first 50m3 of shotcrete and 1 test for every 250m3 of shotcrete thereafter
Conformance Criteria - Min. 35 MPa at 28 days
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - To prove compressive strength compliance requirement
○ Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Table 6.4
Test frequency - 1 test for every 50m3 of sprayed shotcrete
Conformance Criteria - Min. 20 MPa at 7 days
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - To prove compliance with flexural strength requirements
Specifications and Standards - BS EN 14651: 2005 + A1: 2007
○ Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Table 6.4 and 6.1
Test frequency - 1 test for the first 50m3 of shotcrete and 1 test for every 100m3 of shotcrete thereafter
Conformance Criteria - Min. FR,1 of 1.25MPa and FR,4 at 1MPa
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - To prove compliance with shrinkage requirements
○ Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Table 6.4 and 6.1
Test frequency - 1 test for the first 50m3 of shotcrete and 1 test for every 250m3 of shotcrete thereafter
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - to prove compliance with permeability requirements
○ Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Table 6.4. and 6.1
Test frequency - 3 tests for the first 50m3 of shotcrete then 1 test every 1 month thereafter
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - To prove compliance with fibre content test requirement
Specifications and Standards - BS EN 14488-7 (fresh concrete)
○ Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Section 4.8
Test frequency - 1 test for the first 50m3 of shotcrete and 1 test for every 100m3 of shotcrete thereafter
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - To prove compliance with the relative density requirement
○ Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Table 6.4 and 6.1
Test frequency - 1 test for the first 50m3 of shotcrete and 1 test for every 250m3 of shotcrete thereafter
Conformance Criteria - Minimum 98% of the density measured from base mix
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report

name: Description - PTT shall define the planned excavation limits and support types (RESS) prior to each defined period of excavation in each heading or bench face.
○ Tunnel excavation shall not commence on a shift until PTT has been signed off
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specifications C0650 - Tunnel Sequential Excavation Section 5.1
Test frequency - Every advance or as agreed in DRM
Description - Recommend the required support type based on the Actual Ground Conditions.
○ Determine any corrective measures required to ensure safety and stability of the excavation.
○ Identify if the ground conditions depart from the expected range of conditions for which a support type has been designed and notify the Designer if new design is required.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specifications C0650 - Tunnel Sequential Excavation Section 5.1
Test frequency - Every advance or as agreed in DRM
Verifying Records - Required Excavation and support sheet
Description - Control the E-Line before, during and after excavation is finished
Method/Description - Surveyor to set out and record as built. VMT system to provide e-line guidance
Verifying Records - Strip Drain Check Sheet
Description - delivery dockets check, slump and temperature check
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Clause 5.4
○ Delivery dockets to include the following; Batch number,

○ Batch temperature at time of dispatch and delivery, Mix designation, Date and time of mixing, Quantity delivered, The delivery truck number, Date and time the delivery truck left the batching plant, Amounts of water, admixture, or any other ingredients made after despatch, and time at which such additions are made, Steel fibre type and content, Micro fibre type and content, and, any other relevant information.
Description - Prepare all surfaces to be shotcreted prior to application of shotcrete
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0650 - Tunnel Civil Works Section 5.4
Conformance Criteria - Surface clean and free of loose material, pre-wet surface immediately prior to spraying.
○ Any residual flowing or seeping water shall be controlled using channels, chases, pipes, or other approved means.
○ Spalled, cracked, loose or contaminated shotcrete removed.
Description - Provide control means to verify the thickness of final shotcrete layer
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0650 - Tunnel Sequential Excavation, section 5.7
Test frequency - As-builts shall be taken of EACH layer of shotcrete
Conformance Criteria - Shotcrete thickness shall be sprayed in accordance with drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8129, 8130, and 3831 and within the tolerances outlined in drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8119
Description - Provide control means to verify the intrados clearance of the shotcrete lining
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0650 - Tunnel Sequential Excavation, section 5.7
Test frequency - As-builts shall be taken of EACH layer of shotcrete
Conformance Criteria - Shotcrete thickness shall be sprayed in accordance with drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8129, 8130, and 3831 and within the tolerances outlined in drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8120
Description - Provide control means to verify the C-line clearance of the shotcrete lining
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0650 - Tunnel Sequential Excavation, section 5.7
Test frequency - As-builts shall be taken of EACH layer of shotcrete
Conformance Criteria - Shotcrete thickness shall be sprayed in accordance with drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8129, 8130, and 3831 and within the tolerances outlined in drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8121

Description - Underside of top heading lining at connection with bench lining to be cleaned by pressure air jet and water and inspected by the designer's representative prior to placement of bench shotcrete.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Clause 3.2 Table 3.1
Conformance Criteria - Hold point released by CPS
Description - The footing invert (top heading and bench) shall be clean and clear of all debris and shotcrete rebound and inspected by designer's representative prior to placement of shotcrete.
Test frequency - Prior to each Spray
Conformance Criteria - Hold point released by CPS
Description - Curing to be carried out in accordance with the Specification
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Clause 5.5
Description - The final layer of shotcrete shall be inspected for any defects and repaired accordingly.

○ At the completion of the lining, all core holes in the lining (resulting from testing or inspection) shall be backfilled with non-shrink mortar of an equivalent strength and fire resistance properties unless otherwise specified. The surface of the restored hole shall be similar to the surrounding surface in texture and colour.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0650 - Tunnel Sequential Excavation, section 5.6
Test frequency - Every defect on Every advance
Verifying Records - Post spray inspection record
Description - To prove position, cover and overlap are achieved
Conformance Criteria - Longitudinal and transverse overlap of 250mm (one mesh square plus 50mm)
○ Min. cover 65mm at the extrados and 85mm at the intrados
Verifying Records - Mesh Check Sheet, As-built
Description - Bolts shall be drilled to the depth, diameter, alignment and position specified on the Drawings or instructed by the Designer.
○ To ensure correct installation process for resin injection
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0652 - Tunnel Rock Reinforcement, section 5.2, 5.3
Conformance Criteria - Bolts shall be installed perpendicular to the excavation face unless stated otherwise.
○ Where rockbolts are not able to be installed perpendicular, the maximum deviation shall be 18 degrees from perpendicular.
— The Constructor shall record a drilling log for each drillhole, including the date and time of installation and any difficulties or problems that were encountered.
— Dowels to be clean or any other physical damage at the time of installation
— Type of bolts, diameter, length, location, spacing and orientation according to detailed design
— Sufficient volume of resin to be used with each rock reinforcement installation in accordance with the approved project specific procedure developed during the trials.
— Daily records of all grouting works to be kept
Verifying Records - Rock Bolt Installation Record, Rock bolt Check Sheet
Description - Bolts to be installed in the position specified on the drawings or as instructed by the designer
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0652 - Tunnel Rock Reinforcement section 5.3
Conformance Criteria - bolts shall be installed perpendicular to the excavation face unless stated otherwise.
○ Where rockbolts are not able to be installed perpendicular, the maximum deviation shall be 18 degrees from perpendicular.
Verifying Records - Rock Bolt As built Survey
Description - Demonstrate that the installed rock reinforcements can provide at least the design working load capacity.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0652 - Tunnel Rock Reinforcement Clause 6.5

Test frequency - 1. The first nine installations of each type of rock bolt and the first nine installations of each type of rock dowel shall be tested in each ground type as it presents in production. At least one test location of each type shall be in the tunnel crown unless otherwise directed by the Designer’s Representative.
2. 5% of the next 100 installations of rock bolts and rock dowels, proportionately throughout the ground types presenting.

Conformance Criteria - The bolt or dowel is deemed acceptable if, during the cycle, the displacement of the bolt or dowel head relative to the measuring datum (after allowing for any temperature changes) does not exceed the criteria for 100% of the working load, as set out in Table 6.4 of the specification.
○ Failure criteria: 2% Maximum Permissible Displacement or failure to maintain specified loads or ongoing creep of the rock bolt or rock dowel
